column4: can someone help me figure out why my vsftpd ftp daemon isnt working?  im trying to connect fith filezilla but keep getting an error "refusing to run with writable anonymous root
what account are you connecting with?
i left the user field blank in filezilla
thats why then
use your Linux account on the server
. thanks, that worked; however, how would i get it to work with an anonymous user
users cannot manipulate services, add sudo

i connected to my ftp server and set the configuration file for the correct directory, and then i put a testfile into the directory to see if i connected to the correct directory, but i dont see the file...so im assuming im in thee wrong directory...what can i do about this?
possibly the larger one is showing the space used on the drive (including slack space)
try in the apache channel, may explain it
he is right about the executable thing, if that's what you mean
does it happen in all browsers?
do you have a desktop UI?
yes
use gnome-schedule
you can use ALT to drag a window from ANY point
there are svn apps native to ubuntu, why do you need a windows based one?
try searching software centre for apps before reaching for wine
sure. The first user is in many by default. You can see them by running: groups
not got one here
may help http://pmungai.wordpress.com/linux/sun-solaris/solaris-install-svn/
